dublin_core.dcvalue: There are no current recommendations regarding the minimum technical specification for realtime telemedicine consultation in accident and emergency A and E practice We assessed the effect of image resolution compression colour depth and display modality on perceived image quality and telediagnosis Test sets of digitized radiographs and clinical images were subjected to a series of standardized manipulations and the resulting output files were evaluated by an expert panel using image scoring and receiver operating characteristic ROC analysis For telemedicine in A and E work the minimum technical specification should be regarded as images containing at least 250 000 pixels compressed at up to JPEG 50 or GIF for colour images and displayed on a high resolution computer monitor These specifications resulted in average file sizes of 17 kByte for digital images and 9 kByte for radiographs
The effect of resolution, compression, colour depth and display modality on the accuracy of accident and emergency telemedicine.
